roleset.name: to specify the genetic code for

example.text: Supt4h2 encodes a 117 amino acid protein nearly identical to the Supt4h gene product with only one amino acid difference, indicating extreme conservation of this expressed processed gene with the spliced gene over evolutionary time.
example.arg: a 117 amino acid protein nearly identical to the Supt4h gene product with only one amino acid difference
example.fdg:
1 Supt4h2 supt4h2 subj:>2 @SUBJ %NH NUM CARD 2 encodes encode main:>0 @+FMAINV %VA V PRES SG3 3 a a det:>7 @DN> %>N DET SG 4 117 117 @QN> %>N NUM CARD 5 amino amino attr:>6 @A> %>N N NOM SG 6 acid acid attr:>7 @A> %>N N NOM SG 7 protein protein obj:>2 @OBJ %NH N NOM SG 8 nearly nearly ad:>9 @AD-A> %E> ADV 9 identical identical @OBJ %NH A ABS 10 to to mod:>9 @14 @DN> %>N DET 12 Supt4h supt4h attr:>13 @A> %>N N NOM SG 13 gene gene attr:>14 @A> %>N N NOM SG 14 product product pcomp:>10 @

20 @ADVL %EH ADV 17 one one qn:>20 @QN> %>N NUM CARD 18 amino amino attr:>19 @A> %>N N NOM SG 19 acid acid attr:>20 @A> %>N N NOM SG 20 difference difference pcomp:>15 @

2 @-FMAINV %VA ING 23 extreme extreme attr:>24 @A> %>N A ABS 24 conservation conservation obj:>22 @OBJ %NH N NOM SG 25 of of mod:>24 @29 @DN> %>N DET DEM SG 27 expressed expressed attr:>28 @A> %>N A ABS 28 processed processed attr:>29 @A> %>N A ABS 29 gene gene pcomp:>25 @

33 @DN> %>N DET 32 spliced spliced attr:>33 @A> %>N A ABS 33 gene gene pcomp:>30 @

22 @ADVL %EH PREP 35 evolutionary evolutionary attr:>36 @A> %>N A ABS 36 time time pcomp:> 34 @

example.text: Compound heterozygous or homozygous mutations spread over all six exons encoding the 6-pyruvoyl-tetrahydropterin synthase cause an autosomal recessively inherited variant of hyperphenylalaninemia, mostly accompanied by a deficiency of dopamine and serotonin.
example.fdg:
1 Compound compound @+FMAINV %VA V IMP 2 heterozygous heterozygous cc:>4 @A> %>N A ABS 3 or or cc:>4 @CC %CC CC 4 homozygous homozygous attr:>5 @A> %>N A ABS 5 mutations mutation obj:>1 @OBJ %NH N NOM PL 6 spread spread mod:>5 @-FMAINV %VP EN 7 over over ha:>6 @ADVL %EH PREP 8 all all det:>10 @DN> %>N DET 9 six six qn:>10 @QN> %>N NUM CARD 10 exons exon pcomp:>7 @

N NOM PL 11 encoding encode mod:>10 @-FMAINV %VA ING 12 the the det:>15 @DN> %>N DET 13 6-pyruvoyl-tetrahydropterin 6-pyruvoyl-tetrahydropterin attr:>14 @A> %>N N NOM SG 14 synthase synthase attr:>15 @A> %>N N NOM SG 15 cause cause obj:>11 @OBJ %NH N NOM SG 16 an an det:>20 @DN> %>N DET SG 17 autosomal autosomal attr:>19 @A> %>N A ABS 18 recessively recessively ad:>19 @AD-A> %E> ADV 19 inherited inherited attr:>20 @A> %>N A ABS 20 variant variant @SUBJ %NH N NOM SG @OBJ %NH N NOM SG 21 of of mod:>20 @21 @

N NOM SG 23 , , 24 mostly mostly @ADVL %EH ADV 25 accompanied accompany @-FMAINV %VP EN 26 by by ha:>25 @ADVL %EH PREP 27 a a det:>28 @DN> %>N DET SG 28 deficiency deficiency pcomp:>26 @

example.text: This is the first known example of such mutations that has apparently abolished the functional splicing of a pre-mRNA encoding a multipass integral membrane protein.
example.fdg:
1 This this subj:>2 @SUBJ %NH PRON DEM SG 2 is be main:>0 @+FMAINV %VA V PRES SG3 3 the the det:>6 @DN> %>N DET 4 first first attr:>5 @A> %>N NUM ORD 5 known known attr:>6 @A> %>N A ABS 6 example example comp:>2 @PCOMPL-S %NH N NOM SG 7 of of mod:>6 @9 @DN> %>N DET 9 mutations mutation pcomp:>7 @

11 @SUBJ %NH PRON 11 has have v-ch:>13 @+FAUXV %AUX V PRES SG3 12 apparently apparently meta:>13 @ADVL %EH ADV 13 abolished abolish mod:>9 @-FMAINV %VA EN 14 the the det:>16 @DN> %>N DET 15 functional functional attr:>16 @A> %>N A ABS 16 splicing splicing obj:>13 @OBJ %NH N NOM SG 17 of of mod:>16 @19 @DN> %>N DET SG 19 pre-mRNA pre-mrna pcomp:>17 @

N NOM SG 20 encoding encode mod:>19 @-FMAINV %VA ING 21 a a det:>25 @DN> %>N DET SG 22 multipass multipass attr:>23 @A> %>N A ABS 23 integral integral attr:>24 @A> %>N A ABS 24 membrane membrane attr:>25 @A> %>N N NOM SG 25 protein protein obj:>20 @OBJ %NH N NOM SG 26 . .

example.text: The PRP17 gene of the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae encodes a protein that participates in the second step of the splicing reaction.
example.arg: The PRP17 gene of the yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae
a protein that participates in the second step of the splicing reaction
example.fdg:
1 The the det:>3 @DN> %>N DET 2 PRP17 prp17 attr:>3 @A> %>N N NOM SG 3 gene gene subj:>9 @SUBJ %NH N NOM SG 4 of of mod:>3 @8 @DN> %>N DET 6 yeast yeast attr:>7 @A> %>N N NOM SG 7 Saccharomyces saccharomyces attr:>8 @A> %>N N NOM SG 8 cerevisiae cerevisiae pcomp:>4 @

17 @21 @DN> %>N DET 20 splicing splicing attr:>21 @A> %>N A ABS 21 reaction reaction pcomp:>18 @

example.text: The human SNRPN (small nuclear ribonucleoprotein polypeptide N) gene is one of a gene family that encode proteins involved in pre-mRNA splicing and maps to the smallest deletion region involved in the Prader-Willi syndrome (PWS) within chromosome 15q11-q13.
example.fdg:
1 The the det:>3 @DN> %>N DET 2 human human attr:>3 @A> %>N A ABS 3 SNRPN snrpn @SUBJ %NH N NOM SG @OBJ %NH N NOM SG @PCOMPL-O %NH N NOM SG 4 ( ( 5 small small attr:>6 @A> %>N A ABS 6 nuclear nuclear attr:>7 @A> %>N A ABS 7 ribonucleoprotein ribonucleoprotein attr:>8 @A> %>N N NOM SG 8 polypeptide polypeptide attr:>9 @A> %>N N NOM SG 9 N n @SUBJ %NH ABBR NOM SG @APP %NH ABBR NOM SG @A> %>N ABBR NOM SG @NH %NH ABBR NOM SG 10 ) ) 11 gene gene @SUBJ %NH N NOM SG @OBJ %NH N NOM SG @APP %NH N NOM SG 12 is be @+FMAINV %VA V PRES SG3 13 one one comp:>12 @PCOMPL-S %NH NUM CARD 14 of of mod:>13 @17 @DN> %>N DET SG 16 gene gene attr:>17 @A> %>N N NOM SG 17 family family pcomp:>14 @

example.text: Expression SBP2 Northern analysis of poly (A) + RNA from various tissues reveals that SBP2 may be encoded by as many as three distinct transcripts.

example.text: It is possible, therefore, that the added sequences in the larger forms of SBP2 mRNA are involved in regulating its expression of encoding proteins with other functions.
example.arg: the added sequences in the larger forms of SBP2 mRNA
example.fdg:
1 It it subj:>2 @SUBJ %NH PRON NOM SG3 2 is be main:>0 @+FMAINV %VA V PRES SG3 3 possible possible comp:>2 @PCOMPL-S %NH A ABS 4 , , 5 therefore therefore meta:>2 @ADVL %EH ADV 6 , , 7 that that pm:>19 @CS %CS CS 8 the the det:>10 @DN> %>N DET 9 added added attr:>10 @A> %>N A ABS 10 sequences sequence subj:>18 @SUBJ %NH N NOM PL 11 in in mod:>10 @14 @DN> %>N DET 13 larger large attr:>14 @A> %>N A CMP 14 forms form pcomp:>11 @

example.text: In plants it is estimated that between 1000 and 5000 chloroplast proteins are encoded by nuclear genes (Martin and Herrmann, 1998) and, by analogy, in Apicomplexa most of the protein content of the apicoplast will most likely also be nucleus encoded.
example.fdg:
1 In in cla:>5 @ADVL %EH PREP 2 plants plant pcomp:>1 @

4 @SUBJ %NH PRON NOM SG3 4 is be v-ch:>5 @+FAUXV %AUX V PRES SG3 5 estimated estimate main:>0 @-FMAINV %VP EN 6 that that @CS %CS CS 7 between between @ADVL %EH PREP 8 1000 1000 cc:>10 @QN> %>N NUM CARD 9 and and cc:>10 @CC %CC CC 10 5000 5000 qn:>12 @QN> %>N NUM CARD 11 chloroplast chloroplast attr:>12 @A> %>N N NOM SG 12 proteins protein pcomp:>7 @

example.text: In this vector the T.gondii dhfr-ts region was excised with BamHI and KpnI and replaced with human dhfr mutated to encode resistance to WR99210 (Fidock and Wellems, 1997).
example.fdg:
1 In in cla:>9 @ADVL %EH PREP 2 this this det:>3 @DN> %>N DET DEM SG 3 vector vector pcomp:>1 @

7 @DN> %>N DET 5 T.gondii t.gondii attr:>6 @A> %>N N NOM SG 6 dhfr-ts dhfr-t attr:>7 @A> %>N N NOM PL 7 region region subj:>8 @SUBJ %NH N NOM SG 8 was be v-ch:>9 @+FAUXV %AUX V PAST 9 excised excise main:>0 @-FMAINV %VP EN 10 with with com:>9 @ADVL %EH PREP 11 BamHI bamhi pcomp:>10 @
